questionsData.title: An acid tastes sour.
The gas particles can fill any space.
Light has no energy.
Volume is quietness.
questionsData.explain_answer: volume and quietness are opposite concepts. Volume represents the loudness of sound, while quietness refers to the low sound.

questionsData.title: Vaccination means giving disease to prevent disease.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Vaccines work by exposing your body to a weakened or inactive form of a virus or bacteria. This triggers your immune system to develop antibodies that can fight off the real disease if you encounter it later. 

diseases are spread by germs.and vaccination using a very weak form of the disease could lead to immunity.

questionsData.title: Gibbous is one of the sun's phases.
Books are made of wool.
Crops are planted in the desert.
"Unusual animal" means " uncommon animal"
Destroyed and demolished are antonyms.
"Swept away" means moved quickly.
During an earthquake the wind flattens everything.
Youth is the late part of a person's life.
To run an office is "to mismanage" it.
questionsData.explain_answer: To run an office is to "effective management".it

questionsData.title: "Liked by the other people" means " very popular".
Lion tamer is somebody who tames lions.
Harvest is to take from trees.
"Changing the color of peas" means "stuffing".
"Crew" means "staff".
To kick is to hit with your foot.
The text is mainly talking about ………..
questionsData.article:
Tea is an aromatic beverage. It is made from the leaves of Camellia. It is classified into five main types: Black,
Green, Oolong, White, and Puerth. Black tea is historically the most (common 1) in the western world. Green tea
may (benefit 2) the heart. Tea is popular in countries around the world. In history, tea drinking was important part
of customs in some countries. There were different customs for drinking tea. In Britain, the British like a nice cup
at half past seven in the morning, their idea of heaven is a nice cup of tea. In China and Japan, tea was first used as
a medicine. Years later, they started to take it as a daily drink. There are many interesting tea customs that have
developed over the countries. For example, people in Japan serve green tea in small cups, however British prefer
black tea. In India, people might drink tea with milk and sugar. In Morocco, people drink tea with sugar and mint.
Tea may no longer be considered as cure for all illnesses, but ( it 3) is a remedy for both the body and the spirit in
our life.

questionsData.title: He gave me …….piece of advice.
One of the following is a compound word ……..
My present salary is fifty thousand rails. The word "present" is a/ an….
questionsData.explain_answer: The word "present" in the given sentence is an adjective. It is describing the noun "salary". Adjectives are used to describe nouns or pronouns.

questionsData.title: Which one of the following is a suffix?
Ibb governorate is …… than Marib.
Ahmed is not as . . . . as his brother.
I got …… of my car to greet my teacher.
Sunday is the day …… I met him
Yemen is an agricultural country, ….., many crops are imported from abroad.
That house looks …….
Doctors …… the pulse of the patients.
Khalid is …… to Spain next year.
We look forward to …… you.
questionsData.explain_answer:
We look forward to Seeing  you.

  • Seeing is the gerund form of the verb "see." Gerunds function as nouns and can be used as the object of a preposition like "to" in this case.
  • See is the base verb form and wouldn't create a complete sentence structure here.
  • Saw is the past tense of "see" and doesn't fit the context of looking forward to a future event.
  • Sees is the third-person singular present tense and wouldn't be appropriate because "look forward to" implies anticipation of a future event.

questionsData.title: While she was cooking, she …… her hands.
questionsData.explain_answer: The structure "while + past continuous" is often used in combination with the past simple tense to express two  actions in the past.

questionsData.title: A door is . . . . of wood.
The plane ……arrived, yet.
Adnan heard Arwa . . . in the kitchen.
It . . .a ring. I am extremely sure.
My mother opened the door ……
Have your brother …… the lesson.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Use of have/get + infinitive

You use these verbs to replace other instruction words such as ask, tell or order.

Example:

Ask the boy to put away his bag.
→    Have the boy put away his bag.
→    Get the boy to put away his bag.
Note: With have, the infinitive is without to.
